meeting_sections.section_name: SPECIAL ORDER OF BUSINESS - OPERATIONAL ITEMS/BOARD DISCUSSION AND/OR ACTION

items.item_details:
Members of the public may address the Board on any subject not on tonight’s agenda; however, provisions of the Brown Act (Government Code Section 54954.2(a) and 54954.3) preclude any action.  As an unagendized item, no response is required from the Board or District staff and no action can be taken; however, the Board may instruct the Superintendent to agendize the item for a future meeting.  When your name is called, please come to the podium, state your name for the record, and limit your remarks to three (3) minutes.
	 
Persons wishing to address the Board must fill out a gold request form, which is located at the entrance of the Board Room.

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT
		 
Item:  8.01
		 
		 
TO:
Board of Trustees
					 
					 
FROM:
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
					 
					 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action regarding 2013 California School Boards Association (CSBA) Delegate Assembly Election
		 
		 
		 
Attached please find the ballot material for election of a representative to the 2013 CSBA Delegate Assembly for our region. The Board is requested to vote for no more than five (5) candidates. Regardless of the number of vacancies, the Board of Trustees may cast no more than one vote for any one candidate.
		Election results from CSBA will be available no later than April 1, 2013. All re-elected and newly elected Delegates will serve two-year terms beginning April 1, 2013, - March 31, 2015.
		 
		 
Recommendation:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees vote for no more than five (5) candidates for submission of the Official 2013 Delegate Assembly Ballot to CSBA.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees vote for no more than five (5) candidates for submission of the Official 2013 Delegate Assembly Ballot to CSBA.

meeting_sections.section_name: HUMAN RESOURCES - OPERATIONAL ITEMS/BOARD DISUSSION AND/OR ACTION

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT 
Item:  10.01
TO:
Board of Trustees
									 
FROM:  
									 
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
								 
								 
PREPARED BY:
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services, and Karen Poon, Director of Finance
								 
								 
SUBJECT:
Discussion and/or Action of Second Interim Financial Report
					 
					 
This is the Second of two Interim Reports to be presented to the Governing Board for the 2012-13 fiscal year.  The report provides the Board with the financial status of the district as of January 31, 2013.  This report is presented to the Board to provide the current fiscal status of the district and to meet the fiscal accountability requirements of AB 1200.  
					 
Included in the accompanying binder is an executive summary which summarizes the financial data from the SACS reporting system and budget assumptions that provide the basis for determining the District’s fiscal status.  In addition, there are supporting documentation and comparative analysis of the 2012/13 First Interim vs. Second Interim Update as of January 31, 2013, multi-year projections, state reporting forms, and other related documents.  These documents and worksheets serve as tools to certify the ongoing fiscal health of the District for this current year as well as the two subsequent fiscal years.  
					 
California school district revenues and expenditures are subject to constant change.  School district budgets are not static documents, but instead are constantly revised to respond to decisions and actions at the state, local, and federal levels.  The Second Interim Report financial projections have been updated to reflect new information received and board actions taken since the Budget was adopted.  
					 
Education Code Section 42131 requires that the Governing Board of each school district to certify in writing within 45 days after the close of the period being reported, whether or not the school district is able to meet its financial obligations for the remainder of the fiscal year and subsequent two fiscal years.  The certification is classified as either positive, qualified, or negative.   
					 
Based on the Districts Second Interim report and multi-year projections as of January 31, 2013, I am recommending that the Board approve the attached positive certification for the East Side Union High School District.  Your approval will provide certification to the State ensuring that the District is able to meet its financial obligations for the current fiscal year and subsequent two fiscal years.  
					 
FINANCIAL IMPACT:
Not Applicable
					 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Not Applicable
					 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended the Board of Trustees approve the positive certification of the 2012-13 Second Interim Report/Revision to the operating budget as presented.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended the Board of Trustees approve the positive certification of the 2012-13 Second Interim Report/Revision to the operating budget as presented.
items.item_text: Discussion and/or Action of Second Interim Financial Report - Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services, and Karen Poon, Director of Finance
items.item_text_raw: 10.01 Discussion and/or Action of Second Interim Financial Report - Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services, and Karen Poon, Director of Finance

items.item_details:
EAST SIDE UNION HIGH SCHOOL DISTRICT 
Item:  10.02
TO:
Board of Trustees
									 
FROM:  
									 
Chris D. Funk, Superintendent
								 
								 
PREPARED BY:
Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services
								 
								 
SUBJECT:
Adopt Resolution #2012/2013-22 Declaring an Emergency and Authorizing Superintendent or His Designee to Enter into Contracts for the Repair and remediation of Fire Damage at Independence High School       
					 
					 
As a result of a fire that occurred at Independence High School Campus on Sunday, March 3, 2013, the District is requesting that the Board of Trustees authorize an Emergency Resolution.  The fire at the B Villa was caused by someone unknown to the District who set fire to the vending machines at the south end of the building.  The fire spread to the interstitial space between the ceiling and roof on the southeast area, resulting in extensive structural damage in addition to water, smoke and soot that has affected every part of the building.  Time is of the essence in these kinds of situations. The remediation work needs to proceed immediately as the longer the soot and debris remains in place the more difficult the odor removal process can be and the smoke and soot will have a corrosive effect on the facility and its contents.  Moreover, an architectural firm, with structural, mechanical, electrical and hazardous materials sub-consultants, will need to assess the extent of the damage, develop repair plans, seek approval from the Division of the State Architect; then a construction contract will need to be awarded to implement the repairs.  The entire process is anticipated to take several months to execute, provided the normal time frames and processes related to procurement of the professional and construction services is bypassed.  The Emergency Resolution Declaring an Emergency enables the District to forgo the normal time frame and processes related to the work and to engage a contractor(s) for the repair and remediation work without advertising for or inviting bids.
					 
FINANCIAL IMPACT:
Unknown at this time
					 
FUNDING SOURCE:
Property/Liability
					 
RECOMMENDATION:
It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution 2012/2013-22 declaring an emergency pursuant to Public Contract Code section 1104 and 20113 and authorizing the Superintendent or his designee to enter into contracts for the repair and remediation of the fire damage at B Villa at Independence High School.
items.item_recommendation: It is recommended that the Board of Trustees adopt Resolution 2012/2013-22 declaring an emergency pursuant to Public Contract Code section 1104 and 20113 and authorizing the Superintendent or his designee to enter into contracts for the repair and remediation of the fire damage at B Villa at Independence High School.

items.item_text_raw: 10.02 Adopt Resolution #2012/2013-22 Declaring an Emergency and Authorizing Superintendent or His Designee to Enter into Contracts for the Repair and Remediation of Fire Damage at Independence High School - Marcus Battle, Associate Superintendent of Business Services
